channel.title: Help the noob
channel.description:
Is there a way to make it so you can't teleport out of a certain area?
EX: If you were at the lumbridge bank, you couldn't teleport.
Otherwise known as teleblocking.
Can someone lead me to a tutorial or something? thanks.

item.title: Help the noob
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

[quote=“edge®, post:12, topic:336302”]do almost exactly what revengr said, but make a void.

  1. Search for public void, above that add this:

public void nontelespot() { (absX > #### && absX < #### && absY > #### && absY < ####) }
Tip: With the command ::coords, you can see your location.

  1. go to your teleport command. Example “home”

make it look like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) {
if (nontelespot()) {
sendMessage("You cannot teleport from your current location -edge");
} else {
toX = ####; //if this doesn't work change the toX to absX
toY = ####; //if this doesn't work change the toY to absY
sendMessage("Welcome at Home -Edge"); 
}
}

Enjoy.
You made your fist command![/quote]This only stops him from teleporting in the bad spot if he’s using the ::home command.
You have to put this in the (every?) teleporting void to make it work for everything that calls for a teleport, unless you want to call it for every single thing that makes you teleport.
He just has to figure out what his teleporting void is called.
(Firefox thinks teleport is spelled wrong, lol)

[quote=“Marc8333, post:11, topic:336302”]Anyone else for an Allstar source?[/quote]I’ll find it when I get back in about an hour.

Read full topic

item.title: Help the noob
item.dc:creator: @edge1 edge®
item.description:
@edge1 wrote:

do almost exactly what revengr said, but make a void.

  1. Search for public void, above that add this:

public void nontelespot() { (absX > #### && absX < #### && absY > #### && absY < ####) }
Tip: With the command ::coords, you can see your location.

  1. go to your teleport command. Example “home”

make it look like this:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("home")) {
if (nontelespot()) {
sendMessage("You cannot teleport from your current location -edge");
} else {
toX = ####; //if this doesn't work change the toX to absX
toY = ####; //if this doesn't work change the toY to absY
sendMessage("Welcome at Home -Edge"); 
}
}

Enjoy.
You made your fist command!

Read full topic

item.title: Help the noob

item.description:
@4markie wrote:

this is EXACTLY what I need but my server isn’t really compatible with that. It’s a 317 sendMessage. Anyone else wanna give it a shot?

Read full topic

item.title: Help the noob
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

In client.java (Server-side), Search for…

public void triggerTele

(hopefully your source uses this…)

You should see this a few lines down.

resetWalkingQueue();

Right below that line, put this…

if(absX > #### && absX < #### && absY > #### && absY < ####){ sM("You cannot teleport here."); return; }

Replace the #### with four digit coordinates.
Type ::mypos to find out what your current co’ords are.

(absX > (This number is the lowest X-coord) && absX < (This number is the highest X-coord) && absY > (This number is the lowest Y-coord) && absY < (This number is the highest Y-coord))

This makes it so if your inbetween the two stated X and Y coords, it won’t let you teleport, and it will send a message saying you can’t.

Read full topic

can you guys make some instructions. Like where to put the code. Thanks, I’m a total noob. You may have really noticed by now

item.title: Help the noob
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

[quote author=Dell link=topic=432677.msg3176135#msg3176135 date=1270861389]
if players coords equal that location, loop teleblock.

Hint*

x= 3404 y=3939
teleblock = true

Read full topic

item.title: Help the noob
item.dc:creator: @attk_mast3r attk mast3r
item.description:
@attk_mast3r wrote:

what dell means is get the coordinates of the area. (min x && y && max x && y) then loop the teleblock to the coordinates, i had a similar problem except i wad making an area that was wild to safe && i didn’t know where to put the coordinates.

Read full topic
